body:
hong yie @ http://www.slightlymagic.net/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=10323&start=105#p131258 suggested

do we have someway to apply "tap an untapped ... creature" to pay a cost of ability before? i see many interesting cards use this "tap" to pay a cost of its ability
author: [melvinzh...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/108278210804167927868/)
title: allow tap an untapped ... creature as cost

comments.body: we are already there, aren't we?
comments.author: [Landhotel.Westerwald](https://code.google.com/u/Landhotel.Westerwald/)

comments.body: Almost, we only support specifically "tap an untapped creature you control" I think a more complete solution should support "tap an untapped <subtype> creature you control" and other variants.
comments.author: [melvinzh...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/108278210804167927868/)

comments.body:
better: "tap an untapped <subtype || type> you crontrol"

remember Benthicore? it doesn't necessarily need to be a creature to be tapped.
comments.author: [Landhotel.Westerwald](https://code.google.com/u/Landhotel.Westerwald/)

comments.body:
I see your "tap an untapped <subtype || type> you control" and raise you:

    "tap <amount> untapped <subtype || type> you control"
comments.author: [ShawnieBoyUK](https://code.google.com/u/ShawnieBoyUK/)
